name: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - A precondition survey of Waka Kotahi and other public / private assets within the extent of the Site and immediately beyond the outside area of the construction activities shall be undertaken in conjunction with the Engineer prior to the Contractor taking possession of the Site.
Verifying Document - Precondition Survey report and plan
Frequency - Prior to the Contractor taking possession of the Site.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - All plants inspected at nursery
Frequency - Invite SPEC to inspect minimum 10 days before delivery.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Approval of Contractors proposed plant species substitution
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Proposed topsoil sampled and laboratory tested to F-3.1 and 3.2
Testing Quantity Required - 10 equal samples mixed. 1kg supplied to lab
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Representative sample kept on site for landscape Architects inspection, if requested
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Topsoil improvement methodology (if required by testing) and grassed area fertilisation methodology and programme
Standard / Specification - P39 B-4, P39 F-3.2, PS 25.10.2
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Datasheet and sample of all types of biodegradable matting and netting supplied to Engineer.
Standard / Specification - PS 25.9.1, P39 B-4, P39 G-3.9
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Sample of bark or arb mulch provided to Engineer for approval
Standard / Specification - PS 25.9.2.1, P39 B-4, P39 G-3.9
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Provide Supplier's grass seed brand and seed mix, and application rate for Engineers approval
○ Provide Supplier's hydroseed mix for Engineers approval
Standard / Specification - P39 H-2.1, P39 I-2.2
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Provide Supplier's installation and maintenance rquirements to Engineer
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - provide fertiliser product details to Engineer for planting, turf, grass and hydrograss
4.39.11 - Contractor to develop hard landscaping materials ITP once the design has been completed
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - A detailed work plan shall be prepared for all landscape works,
Frequency - Two weeks prior to landscape works
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Inspect cut surfaces prior to the placement of topsoil and planting. Inspect Cultivation prior to planting or topsoiling.
Standard / Specification - PS 15.10.10 Drawings, PS 25.1.6(c), PS 25.8.1, P39 C-5.13, P39 B-4, P39 F-3.5.2
Frequency - 2 days prior to Topsoil Placement
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Topsoil depth check. (Planted areas topsoil 300mm, grassed areas 100mm, pb95 tree pits 1000x1000x1000)
Verifying Document - Survey Plan showing depth generated from before/after survey.
Testing Quantity Required - Random manual dig check by Eng.
18.01.4 - Pest Plant and Animal Control methodology
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Submit methodology for approval
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - written notification to Engineer 2 days before pest control or spraying operations. at least 24hr notice to landowners
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - 100mm depth for all planted areas once settled, not less than 75mm for trees
Testing Quantity Required - Mulch checked during planting audit
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Inspect all plants upon delivery to site.
○ Provide written notice to Eng min 2 days before delivery
Standard / Specification - PS 25.7.1, PS 25.1.6, P39 B-4
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall provide written notice to the Engineer, at least two days prior to Planting or seeding.
Frequency - At least two days prior

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Landscape Archtect Stantec will identify sample areas to be audited to P39 B-6.1 for each planting type, and supply a sample area plan to the Contractor for pegging.
Testing Quantity Required - For planting areas < 2,000 m2, 2 No. sample areas each min. 5% of planting area.
○ For planting areas > 2,000 m2, 2 No. sample areas each min. 2% of planting area.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Following sample area pegging, the Landscape Architect will audit sample area quantities and species composition to P39 B:6 and G:4.5 for each planting mix. Minimum of 95% plant count
Frequency - Prior to planting until all treatments achieved.
Testing Quantity Required - For planting areas < 2,000 m2, 2 No. sample areas each min. 5% of planting area.
○ For planting areas > 2,000 m2, 2 No. sample areas each min. 2% of planting area.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Condition of acceptance inspection - once areas are planted, the Landscape aarchitect will hold an inspection to sample each treatment for density, composition and quality of workmanship.
○ 95% plant density and correct species composition
Verifying Document - P39 B-6.3, Planting sample report, B-6.2 checklist, and NTC
Testing Quantity Required - Planting areas < 500 m2, 1 per 50m2, min. 5.
– Note this is total planting m2 not sample areas
– Repeat sample if >2 faults in >20% of sample. If >2 faults in >20% of average of 2 sample sites, then check all plants in planting area
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Estbalishment 95% coverage, weeds visible not >4, bare patches <100mm diamter
Verifying Document - P39 B-6.3, Planting 3-month maintenance inspection report, B-6.2 checklist, and NTC
Frequency - Following planting and every 3 month inspection
18.03.07 - Maintenance Regime submission (if not already provided as part of work plan)
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Review of regime by Landscaping Architect (Stantec). Approvals sought by local authorities for pest management and confirmed acceptance by WSP.
Verifying Document - SPEC review and Designer approval
Frequency - prior to installing planting works.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Written notice to the Engineer, at least 5 days prior to Site visits during maintenance period. Contractor to submit report
Standard / Specification - PS 25.1.6, P39 B-4 & K-2.1
Frequency - At least five days prior

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Plants inspected and measured for growth, checked for health - quartely inspectons until achieved targets. Observe grass coverage 80% canopy coverage, 100% survival of trees and grass areas 95% - <100mm dia gap acceptable defects liability period and maintenance period for 5years
Standard / Specification - P39 Section K 6.3 & 6.4 & section B 6,7,8
Verifying Document - P39 B-3 & B-6.3, Planting 3-month maintenance inspection report, B-6.2 checklist, and NTC
Frequency - Every 3 months during defects liability and maintenance period (5years)
Testing Quantity Required - Planting areas < 500 m2, 1 per 50m2, min. 5.
– Note this is total planting m2 not sample areas
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - 100% Large plants >PB27 healthy, maximum 10% small plant loss, 80% plant canopy, planted area weeds limited to 4 visible at any point
○ 95% grass cover, weeds <4 visible, no kikuyu
Standard / Specification - P39 A-2, P39 G-1, P39 H-4.7, P39 K-1.1
Verifying Document - End of Planting Defects Liability
Frequency - 1 inspection upon completion of defects and maintenance period
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Record of Landowner liaison confirming temporary fence
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Fenceline ground contour finalised prior to discussing fence with landowner
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Record of Landowner liaison confirming permanent 7-wire P&W fence and gate provision in accordfance with landowner agreement
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Fence postion tolerance survey
18.05.1 - Contractor to develop hard landscaping ITP once the design has been completed
